channel.description: Recent content in YifanWang on Yifan Wang

item.title: Patch-base progressive 3D Point Set Upsampling
item.description: Results $16\times$ upsampling from 625 points $16\times$ upsampling from 5000 points $16\times$ upsampling from scan data $16\times$ upsampling from virtual scan data References PU-Net: L. Yu, X. Li, C.-W. Fu, D. Cohen-Or, and P.-A. Heng, “Pu-net: Point cloud upsampling network”, CVPR 2018 EC-Net: L. Yu, X. Li, C.-W. Fu, D. Cohen-Or, and P.-A. Heng, “Ec-net: an edge-aware point set consolidation network”, ECCV 2018

item.title: A Fully Progressive Approach to Single-Image Super-Resolution
item.description: We set a new benchmark for single-image super-resolution by exploiting progressiveness both in architecture and training. The proposed multi-scale models, ProSR and ProSRGan, improve the reconstruction quality in terms of PSNR and visual quality respectively. ProSR is one of the winning teams.

item.title: Two-Stream SR-CNNs for Action Recognition in Videos
YifanWang
item.description: I’m a PhD student in the Interactive Geometry Lab (IGL) at ETH Zurich supervised by Prof. Olga Sorkine-Hornung. Before joining IGL, I received my Bachelor degree with distinction in Electrical Engineering and Information Technology (Elektrotechnik und Informationstechnik) at Technische Universität München (TUM) and completed my Master with distinction in Robotics, System and Control at ETH Zurich. My areas of research lies in applying machine learning techniques, especially deep learning, to challenging image and geometry processing problems.
